pyorganoid.base module

class pyorganoid.base.Agent(position)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for all agents in the simulation (not to be instantiated directly). It represents a single entity in the environment and is used as an interface for different types of agents (e.g., cells, molecules). The agent can have multiple modules that define its behavior.

Parameters:

position (tuple) – The position of the agent in the environment.

position

The position of the agent in the environment.

Type:

{tuple, int}

modules

List of modules that define the behavior of the agent.

Type:

list

add_module(module)[source]

Add a module to the agent.

update()[source]

Update the agent’s state based on its modules.

add_module(module)[source]

Add a module to the agent.

Parameters:

module (BaseModule) – The module to add to the agent.

update()[source]

Update the agent’s state based on its modules. This method should be called at each time step to update the agent’s state based on its modules.

class pyorganoid.base.Cell(position)[source]

Bases: Agent

Base class for all cell agents in the simulation (typically not instantiated directly). It represents a single cell in the environment and extends the Agent class with additional functionality specific to cells. It is a subclass of the Agent class.

Parameters:

position (tuple) – The position of the cell in the environment.

position

The position of the cell in the environment.

Type:

{tuple, int}

modules

List of modules that define the behavior of the cell.

Type:

list

history

List of historical values for the cell.

Type:

list

add_module(module)

Add a module to the cell.

update(historical_value=None)[source]

Update the cell’s state based on its modules and historical value.

get_history()[source]

Get the historical values of the cell.

get_history()[source]

Get the historical values of the cell.

Returns:

List of historical values for the cell.

Return type:

list

update(historical_value=None)[source]

Update the cell’s state based on its modules and historical value.

Parameters:

historical_value (any, optional) – The historical value to append to the cell’s history. Default is None.

class pyorganoid.base.Organoid(environment)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for all organoids in the simulation (typically not instantiated directly). It represents a collection of agents in the environment and is used to simulate the behavior of a group of agents.

Parameters:

environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid exists.

environment

The environment in which the organoid exists.

Type:

Environment

agents

List of agents (e.g., cells) in the organoid.

Type:

list

add_agent(agent)[source]

Add an agent to the organoid.

get_cells()[source]

Get the list of agents in the organoid.

add_agent(agent)[source]

Add an agent to the organoid.

Parameters:

agent (Agent) – The agent to add to the organoid.

get_cells()[source]

Get the list of agents in the organoid.

Returns:

List of agents (e.g., cells) in the organoid.

Return type:

list

plot_organoid(filename=None, show_properties=True, dpi=300, truncate_cells=10)[source]

Plot the structure of the organoid using Graphviz.

Parameters:

  • filename (str, optional) – The filename to save the plot as (in PNG format). Default is None.

  • show_properties (bool, optional) – Whether to show properties of the agents and modules in the plot. Default is True.

  • dpi (int, optional) – The DPI (dots per inch) of the plot. Default is 300.

  • truncate_cells (int, optional) – The number of cells to show in the plot. If there are more cells, the remaining cells will be truncated. Default is 10.

Raises:

ImportError – If Graphviz is not installed.

class pyorganoid.base.Synapse(pre_neuron, post_neuron, weight=0.5)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for synapses connecting neurons in the simulation. It represents a connection between two neurons and is used to transmit signals between them.

Parameters:

  • pre_neuron (SpikingNeuronCell) – The pre-synaptic neuron.

  • post_neuron (SpikingNeuronCell) – The post-synaptic neuron.

  • weight (float, optional) – The weight of the synapse. Default is 0.5.

pre_neuron

The pre-synaptic neuron.

Type:

SpikingNeuronCell

post_neuron

The post-synaptic neuron.

Type:

SpikingNeuronCell

weight

The weight of the synapse.

Type:

float

transmit()[source]

Transmit a signal from the pre-synaptic neuron to the post-synaptic neuron. This method is called when the pre-synaptic neuron fires an action potential. The post-synaptic neuron’s membrane potential is increased by the weight of the synapse.

pyorganoid.cells module

class pyorganoid.cells.ChemotacticCell(position)[source]

Bases: Cell

A simple cell model that can move towards a chemotactic gradient (e.g., in response to a chemical signal). It is a subclass of the base Cell class.

Parameters:

position ({tuple, int}) – The position of the cell.

position

The position of the cell in the environment.

Type:

{tuple, int}

modules

List of modules that define the behavior of the cell.

Type:

list

history

List of historical values for the cell.

Type:

list

chemotactic_gradient

The chemotactic gradient for the cell. Positive values indicate movement towards the gradient. Negative values indicate movement away from the gradient.

Type:

float

update()[source]

Update the cell’s state.

get_history()

Get the historical values of the cell.

move_towards_gradient(gradient)[source]

Move the cell towards the specified gradient.

get_chemotactic_gradient()[source]

Get the chemotactic gradient of the cell.

get_chemotactic_gradient()[source]

Get the chemotactic gradient of the cell.

Returns:

The chemotactic gradient of the cell.

Return type:

float

move_towards_gradient(gradient)[source]

Move the cell towards the specified gradient.

Parameters:

gradient (float) – The gradient to move towards.

update()[source]

Update the cell’s state based on the chemotactic gradient.

class pyorganoid.cells.DifferentiatingCell(position, state='undifferentiated')[source]

Bases: Cell

A simple cell model that can differentiate into different states (e.g., an undifferentiated stem cell). It is a subclass of the base Cell class.

class pyorganoid.cells.SpikingNeuronCell(position, threshold=1.0, input_data_func=None)[source]

Bases: Cell

A simple spiking neuron cell model (e.g., a Leaky Integrate-and-Fire neuron). The membrane potential is reset to zero after spiking. It is a subclass of the base Cell class.

Parameters:

  • position ({tuple, int}) – The position of the cell.

  • threshold (float, optional) – The threshold for spiking. Default is 1.0.

  • input_data_func (function, optional) – A function to generate input data for the neuron. Default is None.

position

The position of the cell in the environment.

Type:

{tuple, int}

modules

List of modules that define the behavior of the cell.

Type:

list

history

List of historical values for the cell.

Type:

list

membrane_potential

The membrane potential of the neuron.

Type:

float

threshold

The threshold for spiking.

Type:

float

input_data_func

The function to generate input data for the neuron.

Type:

function

update()[source]

Update the cell’s state.

get_history()

Get the historical values of the cell.

spike(verbose=False)[source]

Spike the neuron.

default_input_data_func()[source]

Default input data function based on position.

get_input_data()[source]

Get the input data for the neuron.

static default_input_data_func()[source]

Default input data function based on position. Simply returns a list of 10 input values (this should be overridden by providing an input data function).

Returns:

List of input data values.

Return type:

list

get_input_data()[source]

Get the input data for the neuron.

Returns:

List of input data values.

Return type:

list

spike(verbose=False)[source]

Spike the neuron. The membrane potential is reset to zero after spiking.

Parameters:

verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output. Default is False

update()[source]

Update the cell’s state. Record the membrane potential and spike if it exceeds the threshold.

class pyorganoid.cells.SynapticPlasticityCell(position, initial_synapses=None)[source]

Bases: Cell

A simple cell model that can form synapses with other cells and transmit signals between them. The cells are connected by synapses that can change their strength based on the timing of spikes (e.g., STDP). It is a subclass of the base Cell class.

Parameters:

  • position ({tuple, int}) – The position of the cell.

  • initial_synapses (list, optional) – List of initial synapses for the cell. Default is None.

position

The position of the cell in the environment.

Type:

{tuple, int}

modules

List of modules that define the behavior of the cell.

Type:

list

history

List of historical values for the cell.

Type:

list

synapses

List of synapses connected to the cell.

Type:

list

update()[source]

Update the cell’s state.

add_synapse(synapse)[source]

Add a synapse to the cell.

add_synapse(synapse)[source]

Add a synapse to the cell.

update(historical_value=None)[source]

Update the cell’s state based on its synapses and historical value. Transmit signals between connected cells.

Parameters:

historical_value (any, optional) – The historical value to append to the cell’s history. Default is None.

pyorganoid.environments module

class pyorganoid.environments.ChemicalGradientEnvironment(gradient_func=<function norm>, dimensions=3, size=100.0)[source]

Bases: Environment

Environment with a chemical gradient that can be used by agents to navigate. It is a subclass of the base Environment class.

Parameters:

  • gradient_func (function) – The function that calculates the gradient at a given position. Default is np.linalg.norm.

  • dimensions (int, optional) – The number of dimensions of the environment. Default is 3.

  • size (float, optional) – The size of the environment. Default is 100.0.

conditions

List of conditions in the environment.

Type:

list

dimensions

The number of dimensions of the environment.

Type:

int, optional

size

The size of the environment.

Type:

float, optional

gradient_func

The function that calculates the gradient at a given position.

Type:

function

update()

Update the environment.

add_condition(condition)

Add a condition to the environment

position (array-like) – The position at which to calculate the concentration.

class pyorganoid.environments.Environment(dimensions=3, size=100.0)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for environments. Environments can have conditions that change over time. Conditions are objects that have an update method.

Parameters:

  • dimensions (int, optional) – The number of dimensions of the environment. Default is 3.

  • size (float, optional) – The size of the environment. Default is 100.0.

conditions

List of conditions in the environment.

Type:

list

dimensions

The number of dimensions of the environment.

Type:

int

size

The size of the environment.

Type:

float

update()[source]

Update the environment.

add_condition(condition)[source]

Add a condition to the environment

add_condition(condition)[source]

Add a condition to the environment.

Parameters:

condition (object) – The condition to add to the environment.

update()[source]

Update the environment. This method calls the update method of all conditions in the environment.

Environment with a temperature that can change over time. It is a subclass of the base Environment class.

float

The range of temperatures that the environment can have (optional).

class pyorganoid.modules.BaseModule(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for all modules (not to be instantiated directly). Modules are used to implement the logic of the agents in the simulation. Subclasses should implement the run method.

class pyorganoid.modules.GrowthShrinkageModule(ml_model, growth_amount=0.1, growth_variance=0.05, prediction_threshold=0.5)[source]

Bases: BaseMLModule

Module for simulating growth and shrinkage of cells using a machine learning model. The module collects the volume of the agent as input and applies the prediction to the volume. It is a subclass of the BaseMLModule class.

Parameters:

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model to use for prediction.

  • growth_amount (float, optional) – The amount by which the cells grow at each time step. Default is 0.1.

  • growth_variance (float, optional) – The variance of the growth amount. Default is 0.05.

  • prediction_threshold (float, optional) – The threshold above which the cells grow and below which they shrink. Default is 0.5.

ml_model

The machine learning model to use for prediction.

Type:

BaseMLModel

growth_amount

The amount by which the cells grow at each time step.

Type:

float, optional

growth_variance

The variance of the growth amount.

Type:

float, optional

prediction_threshold

The threshold above which the cells grow and below which they shrink.

Type:

float, optional

run(agent, verbose=False)

Run the module on the given agent.

collect_input_data(agent)[source]

Collect the input data for the machine learning model.

apply_prediction(agent, prediction)[source]

Apply the prediction of the machine learning model to the agent.

apply_prediction(agent, prediction)[source]

Apply the prediction of the machine learning model to the agent. If the prediction is greater than 0.5, the agent (cell) grows; otherwise, it shrinks.

Parameters:

  • agent (Agent) – The agent to apply the prediction to.

  • prediction (array-like) – The prediction output of the machine learning model.

class pyorganoid.organoids.GeneRegulationOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of cells with gene regulation modules. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class. NOTE: In the future, this class could be extended to include sequence data and gene expression profiles.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the gene regulation cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of gene regulation cells in the organoid. Default is 10.

class pyorganoid.organoids.GrowthShrinkageOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10, initial_cell_volume=1.0, growth_amount=0.1, growth_variance=0.05, prediction_threshold=0.5)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of cells that grow and shrink based on machine learning predictions. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the growth/shrinkage cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of growth/shrinkage cells in the organoid. Default is 10.

  • initial_cell_volume (float, optional) – The initial volume of the cells. Default is 1.0. Use “None” for random volumes in the range [0.5, 1.5].

  • growth_amount (float, optional) – The amount by which the cells grow at each time step. Default is 0.1.

  • growth_variance (float, optional) – The variance of the growth amount. Default is 0.05.

  • prediction_threshold (float, optional) – The threshold above which the cells grow and below which they shrink. Default is 0.5.

class pyorganoid.organoids.ImmuneResponseOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of immune cells that respond to external stimuli. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the immune cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of immune cells in the organoid. Default is 10.

class pyorganoid.organoids.SpikingNeuronOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10, input_data_func=None)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of spiking neurons. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the spiking neuron modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of spiking neurons in the organoid. Default is 10.

  • input_data_func (callable, optional) – A function that generates input data for the spiking neurons. Defaults to ‘() => [0.5] * 10’ if None.

class pyorganoid.organoids.SynapticPlasticityOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10, num_synapses=5)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of neurons with synaptic plasticity (STDP). It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the synaptic plasticity cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of synaptic plasticity cells (i.e., neurons) in the organoid. Default is 10.

  • num_synapses (int, optional) – The number of synapses connecting the plasticity cells. Default is 5.

pyorganoid.simulation module

class pyorganoid.simulation.ParallelScheduler(organoid)[source]

Bases: Scheduler

Scheduler that runs the simulation in parallel using multiple CPU cores. The class has not yet been implemented. It is a subclass of the base Scheduler class.

Parameters:

organoid (Organoid) – The organoid to simulate.

organoid

The organoid to simulate.

Type:

Organoid

simulate(steps)[source]

Simulate the organoid’s behavior over a number of steps.

simulate(steps)[source]

Simulate the organoid’s behavior over a number of steps.

This method is intended to run the simulation in parallel using multiple CPU cores. Currently, this function is not yet implemented. Using joblib may be the most feasible way to implement parallel simulation over multiprocessing; however, the cell history is neither preserved nor updated correctly when executed in parallel.

Parameters:

steps (int) – The number of steps to run the simulation.

Raises:

NotImplementedError –

class pyorganoid.simulation.StochasticScheduler(organoid)[source]

Bases: Scheduler

Scheduler that simulates the organoid’s behavior with a stochastic update rule. The update rule is applied to each agent with a 50% chance. It is a subclass of the base Scheduler class.

class pyorganoid.sklearn_module.SklearnModel(model_path, num_features=None)[source]

Bases: BaseMLModel

This adapter class represents a machine learning model implemented in scikit-learn. It is a subclass of the BaseMLModel class. The scikit-learn addon for pyorganoid must be installed using the pyorganoid[all] package or the command:

pip install pyorganoid[sklearn]

Parameters:

Module contents

class pyorganoid.Agent(position)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for all agents in the simulation (not to be instantiated directly). It represents a single entity in the environment and is used as an interface for different types of agents (e.g., cells, molecules). The agent can have multiple modules that define its behavior.

Parameters:

position (tuple) – The position of the agent in the environment.

position

The position of the agent in the environment.

Type:

class pyorganoid.BaseMLModel[source]

Bases: object

This is the base adapter class for machine learning models used in pyorganoid (not to be instantiated directly). Subclasses should implement the predict method.

Predict the output of the model given an input.

array-like

class pyorganoid.GrowthShrinkageModule(ml_model, growth_amount=0.1, growth_variance=0.05, prediction_threshold=0.5)[source]

Bases: BaseMLModule

Module for simulating growth and shrinkage of cells using a machine learning model. The module collects the volume of the agent as input and applies the prediction to the volume. It is a subclass of the BaseMLModule class.

Parameters:

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model to use for prediction.

  • growth_amount (float, optional) – The amount by which the cells grow at each time step. Default is 0.1.

  • growth_variance (float, optional) – The variance of the growth amount. Default is 0.05.

  • prediction_threshold (float, optional) – The threshold above which the cells grow and below which they shrink. Default is 0.5.

ml_model

The machine learning model to use for prediction.

Type:

BaseMLModel

growth_amount

The amount by which the cells grow at each time step.

Type:

float, optional

growth_variance

The variance of the growth amount.

Type:

float, optional

prediction_threshold

The threshold above which the cells grow and below which they shrink.

Type:

float, optional

run(agent, verbose=False)

Run the module on the given agent.

collect_input_data(agent)[source]

Collect the input data for the machine learning model.

apply_prediction(agent, prediction)[source]

Apply the prediction of the machine learning model to the agent.

apply_prediction(agent, prediction)[source]

Apply the prediction of the machine learning model to the agent. If the prediction is greater than 0.5, the agent (cell) grows; otherwise, it shrinks.

Parameters:

  • agent (Agent) – The agent to apply the prediction to.

  • prediction (array-like) – The prediction output of the machine learning model.

collect_input_data(agent)[source]

Collect the input data for the machine learning model. In this case, the volume of the agent.

agent (Agent) – The agent to collect input data from.

Returns:

The input data for the machine learning model.

Return type:

array-like

class pyorganoid.GrowthShrinkageOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10, initial_cell_volume=1.0, growth_amount=0.1, growth_variance=0.05, prediction_threshold=0.5)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of cells that grow and shrink based on machine learning predictions. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the growth/shrinkage cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of growth/shrinkage cells in the organoid. Default is 10.

  • initial_cell_volume (float, optional) – The initial volume of the cells. Default is 1.0. Use “None” for random volumes in the range [0.5, 1.5].

  • growth_amount (float, optional) – The amount by which the cells grow at each time step. Default is 0.1.

  • growth_variance (float, optional) – The variance of the growth amount. Default is 0.05.

  • prediction_threshold (float, optional) – The threshold above which the cells grow and below which they shrink. Default is 0.5.

class pyorganoid.MetabolicOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of cells with metabolic modules. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the metabolic cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of metabolic cells in the organoid. Default is 10.

class pyorganoid.Organoid(environment)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for all organoids in the simulation (typically not instantiated directly). It represents a collection of agents in the environment and is used to simulate the behavior of a group of agents.

Parameters:

environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid exists.

Environment

plot_organoid(filename=None, show_properties=True, dpi=300, truncate_cells=10)[source]

Plot the structure of the organoid using Graphviz.

Parameters:

  • filename (str, optional) – The filename to save the plot as (in PNG format). Default is None.

  • show_properties (bool, optional) – Whether to show properties of the agents and modules in the plot. Default is True.

  • dpi (int, optional) – The DPI (dots per inch) of the plot. Default is 300.

  • truncate_cells (int, optional) – The number of cells to show in the plot. If there are more cells, the remaining cells will be truncated. Default is 10.

Raises:

ImportError – If Graphviz is not installed.

class pyorganoid.ParallelScheduler(organoid)[source]

Bases: Scheduler

Scheduler that runs the simulation in parallel using multiple CPU cores. The class has not yet been implemented. It is a subclass of the base Scheduler class.

Parameters:

organoid (Organoid) – The organoid to simulate.

organoid

The organoid to simulate.

Type:

Organoid

simulate(steps)[source]

Simulate the organoid’s behavior over a number of steps.

simulate(steps)[source]

Simulate the organoid’s behavior over a number of steps.

This method is intended to run the simulation in parallel using multiple CPU cores. Currently, this function is not yet implemented. Using joblib may be the most feasible way to implement parallel simulation over multiprocessing; however, the cell history is neither preserved nor updated correctly when executed in parallel.

Parameters:

steps (int) – The number of steps to run the simulation.

Raises:

NotImplementedError –

class pyorganoid.PriorityScheduler(organoid, priorities)[source]

Bases: Scheduler

Scheduler that simulates the organoid’s behavior based on a priority system. Agents are updated in order of decreasing priority. It is a subclass of the base Scheduler class.

class pyorganoid.SpikingNeuronCell(position, threshold=1.0, input_data_func=None)[source]

Bases: Cell

A simple spiking neuron cell model (e.g., a Leaky Integrate-and-Fire neuron). The membrane potential is reset to zero after spiking. It is a subclass of the base Cell class.

Parameters:

  • position ({tuple, int}) – The position of the cell.

  • threshold (float, optional) – The threshold for spiking. Default is 1.0.

  • input_data_func (function, optional) – A function to generate input data for the neuron. Default is None.

position

The position of the cell in the environment.

{tuple, int}

list

Update the cell’s state. Record the membrane potential and spike if it exceeds the threshold.

class pyorganoid.SpikingNeuronOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10, input_data_func=None)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of spiking neurons. It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the spiking neuron modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of spiking neurons in the organoid. Default is 10.

  • input_data_func (callable, optional) – A function that generates input data for the spiking neurons. Defaults to ‘() => [0.5] * 10’ if None.

class pyorganoid.StochasticScheduler(organoid)[source]

Bases: Scheduler

Scheduler that simulates the organoid’s behavior with a stochastic update rule. The update rule is applied to each agent with a 50% chance. It is a subclass of the base Scheduler class.

Parameters:

organoid (Organoid) – The organoid to simulate.

organoid

The organoid to simulate.

Type:

Organoid

Simulate the organoid’s behavior over a number of steps with a stochastic update rule.

simulate(steps)[source]

Simulate the organoid’s behavior over a number of steps with a stochastic update rule. The update rule is applied to each agent with a 50% chance.

Parameters:

steps (int) – The number of steps to run the simulation.

class pyorganoid.Synapse(pre_neuron, post_neuron, weight=0.5)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for synapses connecting neurons in the simulation. It represents a connection between two neurons and is used to transmit signals between them.

Parameters:

  • pre_neuron (SpikingNeuronCell) – The pre-synaptic neuron.

  • post_neuron (SpikingNeuronCell) – The post-synaptic neuron.

  • weight (float, optional) – The weight of the synapse. Default is 0.5.

pre_neuron

The pre-synaptic neuron.

Type:

SpikingNeuronCell

post_neuron

The post-synaptic neuron.

Type:

SpikingNeuronCell

weight

The weight of the synapse.

Type:

float

transmit()[source]

Transmit a signal from the pre-synaptic neuron to the post-synaptic neuron. This method is called when the pre-synaptic neuron fires an action potential. The post-synaptic neuron’s membrane potential is increased by the weight of the synapse.

class pyorganoid.SynapticPlasticityCell(position, initial_synapses=None)[source]

Bases: Cell

A simple cell model that can form synapses with other cells and transmit signals between them. The cells are connected by synapses that can change their strength based on the timing of spikes (e.g., STDP). It is a subclass of the base Cell class.

Parameters:

  • position ({tuple, int}) – The position of the cell.

  • initial_synapses (list, optional) – List of initial synapses for the cell. Default is None.

position

The position of the cell in the environment.

Type:

{tuple, int}

modules

List of modules that define the behavior of the cell.

Type:

list

history

List of historical values for the cell.

Type:

list

synapses

List of synapses connected to the cell.

Type:

list

Add a synapse to the cell.

add_synapse(synapse)[source]

Add a synapse to the cell.

update(historical_value=None)[source]

Update the cell’s state based on its synapses and historical value. Transmit signals between connected cells.

Parameters:

historical_value (any, optional) – The historical value to append to the cell’s history. Default is None.

class pyorganoid.SynapticPlasticityModule(synapse, learning_rate=0.01)[source]

Bases: BaseMLModule

Module for simulating spike-timing-dependent plasticity (STDP) in a synapse (e.g., in a physical neural network). The module updates the synaptic weight based on the pre- and post-synaptic spikes. It is a subclass of the BaseMLModule class.

Parameters:

  • synapse (Synapse) – The synapse to update.

  • learning_rate (float, optional) – The learning rate for updating the synaptic weight. Default is 0.01.

synapse

The synapse to update.

Type:

Synapse

learning_rate

The learning rate for updating the synaptic weight.

Type:

float

class pyorganoid.SynapticPlasticityOrganoid(environment, ml_model, num_cells=10, num_synapses=5)[source]

Bases: Organoid

This class represents an organoid composed of neurons with synaptic plasticity (STDP). It is a subclass of the base Organoid class.

Parameters:

  • environment (Environment) – The environment in which the organoid resides.

  • ml_model (BaseMLModel) – The machine learning model used by the synaptic plasticity cell modules.

  • num_cells (int, optional) – The number of synaptic plasticity cells (i.e., neurons) in the organoid. Default is 10.

  • num_synapses (int, optional) – The number of synapses connecting the plasticity cells. Default is 5.
